text: Antonio Corrionero (1554–1633) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Salamanca (1621–1633), and Bishop of Islas Canarias (1614–1621)."Bishop Antonio Corrionero" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved August 27, 2016"Diocese of Salamanca" Catholic- Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved February 29, 2016"Diocese of Salamanca" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved February 29, 2016 ==Biography== Antonio Corrionero was born in Babilafuente, Spain in 1554. On 6 October 1614, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Paul V as Bishop of Islas Canarias. On 26 April 1615, he was consecrated bishop by Pedro González de Mendoza, Archbishop of Granada, with Juan Portocarrero, Bishop of Almeria, and Luis Fernández de Córdoba, Bishop of Malaga, serving as co-consecrators. On 17 May 1621, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Gregory XV as Bishop of Salamanca. He served as Bishop of Salamanca until his death on 4 April 1633. == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Paul V Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Gregory XV Category:1554 births Category:1633 deaths
title: Antonio Corrionero
